match.title: 2nd ODI

image.caption: An overview of the Zohur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium
image.longCaption: An overview of the Zohur Ahmed Chowdhury Stadium, Bangladesh A v England, March 7, 2010

match.hoursInfo: 12.30 start, First Session 12.30-16.00, Interval 16.00-16.45, Second Session 16.45-20.15

headshotImage.longCaption: Ranjan Madugalle player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c Sibanda b Panyangara 80 (110b 5x4 1x6 145m) SR: 72.72

dismissalComment.html: that's a stunner from Sibanda! Short and wide delivery outside off, Anamul cuts fiercely towards point where Sibanda leaps to his right in the air and catches it! Panyangara does a little jig in celebration

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal run out (Chigumbura) 76 (98b 7x4 1x6 126m) SR: 77.55

dismissalComment.html: appeal for run out at the bowler's end! It was a poor delivery down leg, Tamim pulled and found square leg, where there's a fumble and they go for the run, but Tamim did not give it his all while running. Replays show he's fallen short and Tamim falls on the last ball of the Powerplay as it's a direct hit!

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalComment.html: comes down the track and lofts it high in the air, hardly any power behind the shot and that's a very good catch at long off from Panyangara. Mahmudullah took it on the full and chipped it down the ground, high enough to give Panyangara time to run in and dive forward

that's one more, Mushfiqur falls too! He was trying the reverse sweep for the short of length ball that was coming in from outside off, he missed it and the ball struck him in front of off stump. Loud appeal and up goes the finger

that's a stunner from Sibanda! Short and wide delivery outside off, Anamul cuts fiercely towards point where Sibanda leaps to his right in the air and catches it! Panyangara does a little jig in celebration

oh one more, Bangladesh are crumbling here! Another short ball gets a wicket - this one came in, Sabbir pulled it late and holed out to the fine leg fielder to find Kamungozi who had to adjust a bit but took it easily eventually

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal run out (Chigumbura) 76 (98b 7x4 1x6 126m) SR: 77.55

dismissalComment.html: appeal for run out at the bowler's end! It was a poor delivery down leg, Tamim pulled and found square leg, where there's a fumble and they go for the run, but Tamim did not give it his all while running. Replays show he's fallen short and Tamim falls on the last ball of the Powerplay as it's a direct hit!

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan b Sibanda 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Shakib gone first ball, the crowd is stunned! Sibanda bowled from round the wicket, it was short of length outside off but coming in with the angle, Shakib went back to turn it to leg but the ball sneaked through and went under the bat to just hit the top of off stump!

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c Sibanda b Panyangara 80 (110b 5x4 1x6 145m) SR: 72.72

dismissalComment.html: that's a stunner from Sibanda! Short and wide delivery outside off, Anamul cuts fiercely towards point where Sibanda leaps to his right in the air and catches it! Panyangara does a little jig in celebration

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c Kamungozi b Panyangara 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: oh one more, Bangladesh are crumbling here! Another short ball gets a wicket - this one came in, Sabbir pulled it late and holed out to the fine leg fielder to find Kamungozi who had to adjust a bit but took it easily eventually

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Panyangara b Kamungozi 12 (21b 1x4 0x6 24m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: comes down the track and lofts it high in the air, hardly any power behind the shot and that's a very good catch at long off from Panyangara. Mahmudullah took it on the full and chipped it down the ground, high enough to give Panyangara time to run in and dive forward

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim lbw b Kamungozi 27 (29b 1x4 1x6 46m) SR: 93.1

dismissalComment.html: that's one more, Mushfiqur falls too! He was trying the reverse sweep for the short of length ball that was coming in from outside off, he missed it and the ball struck him in front of off stump. Loud appeal and up goes the finger

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza b Chatara 6 (9b 0x4 0x6 17m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: that one keeps a bit low and hits the off stump! It was a slower delivery too, coming in from outside off, Mortaza tried to heave it on leg, missed it completely and the ball didn't miss the off stump

dismissalText.long: c Arafat Sunny b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Solomon Mire c Arafat Sunny b Shakib Al Hasan 50 (79b 2x4 0x6 113m) SR: 63.29

dismissalComment.html: taken! Shakib has struck first ball of his new spell. It was tossed up on middle stump and he looked to drive inside-out through cover. It turned and he ended up slicing his drive, uppishly, and Sunny dives to his right at point and takes an excellent low catch

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura run out (Sabbir Rahman) 38 (31b 5x4 0x6 64m) SR: 122.58

dismissalComment.html: that is brilliant fielding! He comes down the track and plays a checked drive towards mid-off and sets off for the single. Sabbir is the fielder and he quickly susses out that the keeper's end is the one to shy to, since Chigumbura was a little late to respond to Panyangara's call. He threw down the stumps direct, and Chiggy was out by a mile.
gone! Goes for the reverse sweep from outside off, and he ends up gloving it, and it goes off the keeper's shoulder and the man at slip takes a superb overhead catch, diving backwards
bowled him! He's come down the track and it was the arm ball. He looked to defend and it sneaked through the gap between bat and pad and clattered into the stumps
and that's another. Made a lot of room to cut. Was too full for that and it went with the arm and smacked into the middle of leg and middle

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalComment.html: and that is that. Kamungozi comes and goes. Arafat finishes with four wickets, three in this over, all bowled. Again he made room to cut, again it was the arm ball, and this one takes off stump. Massive win for Bangladesh, this

gone! This was another of those slower balls outside off, and it kept a little low as he went for the checked drive into the covers. Played with an angled bat, and it came in off the pitch, took his inside edge, and crashed into the stumps
bowled him! Another ball keeps low, and he was looking to go back and across to defend, ended up in an ungainly crouch after the ball sneaked under his bat and left his stumps in a mess

gone! Mashrafe picks up his third. It's short, angling in, and he closes his bat face to work it into the leg side. It straightened, and the leading edge popped up in the air and Mahmudullah took an excellent catch, running backwards and to his left from short cover and diving full-length at the end

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza b Mashrafe Mortaza 0 (6b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: gone! This was another of those slower balls outside off, and it kept a little low as he went for the checked drive into the covers. Played with an angled bat, and it came in off the pitch, took his inside edge, and crashed into the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Vusi Sibanda b Mashrafe Mortaza 21 (15b 3x4 1x6 28m) SR: 140

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Another ball keeps low, and he was looking to go back and across to defend, ended up in an ungainly crouch after the ball sneaked under his bat and left his stumps in a mess

dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c Mahmudullah b Mashrafe Mortaza 16 (24b 2x4 0x6 41m) SR: 66.66

It straightened, and the leading edge popped up in the air and Mahmudullah took an excellent catch, running backwards and to his left from short cover and diving full-length at the end

dismissalComment.html: gone! Goes for the reverse sweep from outside off, and he ends up gloving it, and it goes off the keeper's shoulder and the man at slip takes a superb overhead catch, diving backwards

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Al-Amin Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Regis Chakabva c Mashrafe Mortaza b Al-Amin Hossain 32 (53b 2x4 0x6 58m) SR: 60.37

dismissalComment.html: got him! It was the slower ball outside off, not quite driving length, and it stopped on Chakabva as he pushed forward to drive. Tried to check his shot but ended up scooping it in the air to mid-off. Mashrafe stumbles backwards as he takes the catch but does well to hold on

dismissalText.long: c Arafat Sunny b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Solomon Mire c Arafat Sunny b Shakib Al Hasan 50 (79b 2x4 0x6 113m) SR: 63.29

Sabbir is the fielder and he quickly susses out that the keeper's end is the one to shy to, since Chigumbura was a little late to respond to Panyangara's call. He threw down the stumps direct, and Chiggy was out by a mile.

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! He's come down the track and it was the arm ball. He looked to defend and it sneaked through the gap between bat and pad and clattered into the stumps

dismissalComment.html: and that's another. Made a lot of room to cut. Was too full for that and it went with the arm and smacked into the middle of leg and middle

image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalText.commentary: Tafadzwa Kamungozi b Arafat Sunny 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and that is that. Kamungozi comes and goes. Arafat finishes with four wickets, three in this over, all bowled. Again he made room to cut, again it was the arm ball, and this one takes off stump. Massive win for Bangladesh, this

dismissalText.commentary: Tafadzwa Kamungozi b Arafat Sunny 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: and that is that. Kamungozi comes and goes. Arafat finishes with four wickets, three in this over, all bowled. Again he made room to cut, again it was the arm ball, and this one takes off stump. Massive win for Bangladesh, this

commentPostTextItems.html: 8.20pm And that is it from all of us. We enjoyed bringing you this match, and we'll be back for the third ODI as well. Hope you join us for that, and keep sending in your comments. Until then, ta ta!

Joker: "Bangladesh bowling attack looks to be world-class on helpful (read slow-low-turning) conditions, toothless otherwise, while Zimbabwe attack is always mediocre. With both side's batting susceptible to adrenaline, Zimbabwe may still fare better in Australia in my opinion."

Gifer: "Must praise the super knock by Chigumbura, even for a while he did make us tensed. Especially because Shakib & Sunny both had only few overs to bowl, other bowler did not seems stable at the end. "

Mashrafe Mortaza, who is also the man of the match: "It was 100% professional. We didn't bat well in the end but the score was good enough. We started well with the ball and the spinners as usual bowled well. We lost our momentum after the opening stand but we still ended up with a good total. He [Shakib at No. 3] is one of the best batsmen, we want him to face as many overs as possible."

First up, it's Elton Chigumbura: "I thought towards the end of the innings we brought it back by taking those wickets and gave ourselves a good chance of chasing it. I was happy with the first half but the second half was disappointing, especially losing those three wickets in the first few overs. Happy for [Mire] that he scored his maiden fifty. He's a good young player. If we could have batted 50 overs, these two games we could have chased down these scores. Unfortunately we are still making the same mistakes."
RijvyBD: "It's always good to see Shakib performing ... it's even better to see BD wining without a massive contribution from Shakib :)"

8.07pm Zimbabwe were never really in it, right from the time they lost all those early wickets to Mashrafe. The seamers used the up-and-down pitch to their advantage with clever use of the slower ball, and Shakib and Arafat gave absolutely nothing away. Good knocks from Mire, Chakabva and Chigumbura, but at least one of them should have carried onto a more substantial score. Bangladesh take a 2-0 lead, and they simply look a far better side in these conditions.

commentTextItems.html: looks to fire it in full, slides it down the leg side

dismissalText.commentary: John Nyumbu b Arafat Sunny 0 (8b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: and that's another. Made a lot of room to cut. Was too full for that and it went with the arm and smacked into the middle of leg and middle
length ball on off stump, pushed down to long-off
looks to sweep from outside off, gets an inside edge to short fine leg

dismissalText.commentary: Tinashe Panyangara b Arafat Sunny 8 (31b 1x4 0x6 40m) SR: 25.8

commentTextItems.html: bowled him! He's come down the track and it was the arm ball. He looked to defend and it sneaked through the gap between bat and pad and clattered into the stumps
full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, straightens and bounces extra to beat the outside edge of his hesitant poke
shortish, rising up into the ribcage and he jumps to get on top of the bounce and works it away towards midwicket
short ball, and Panyangara ducks under it
fullish outside off and this time he frees his arms and launches it over cover. Sabbir runs back from mid-off to stop it near the boundary

commentPreTextItems.html: Banglaman: "Interesting throw by Sabbir - it hit the top of the bail after bouncing. Don't think I ever saw that before." Yup. Only just clipped the leg bail.

commentTextItems.html: short ball outside off and he's too early into the pull. Toe-ends it and it loops in the air but drops short of mid-off
back of a length on middle and off, goes on the back foot to defend
full again, blocked back to the bowler
dropped full on off stump, looks to drive to long-off and hits it uppishly. Arafat dives to his left but can't hold on.
back of a length outside off, and he punches it down to long-off for a single. Only his second scoring shot in 26 balls
goes for a sweep to the full ball on leg stump, is hit on the foot
back of a length on middle stump and he goes back and across to defend
bouncer to greet him, and he ducks under it, taking his eyes off the ball

dismissalText.commentary: Tafadzwa Kamungozi b Arafat Sunny 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and that is that. Kamungozi comes and goes. Arafat finishes with four wickets, three in this over, all bowled. Again he made room to cut, again it was the arm ball, and this one takes off stump. Massive win for Bangladesh, this

gone! This was another of those slower balls outside off, and it kept a little low as he went for the checked drive into the covers. Played with an angled bat, and it came in off the pitch, took his inside edge, and crashed into the stumps
bowled him! Another ball keeps low, and he was looking to go back and across to defend, ended up in an ungainly crouch after the ball sneaked under his bat and left his stumps in a mess

gone! Mashrafe picks up his third. It's short, angling in, and he closes his bat face to work it into the leg side. It straightened, and the leading edge popped up in the air and Mahmudullah took an excellent catch, running backwards and to his left from short cover and diving full-length at the end

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalComment.html: got him! It was the slower ball outside off, not quite driving length, and it stopped on Chakabva as he pushed forward to drive. Tried to check his shot but ended up scooping it in the air to mid-off. Mashrafe stumbles backwards as he takes the catch but does well to hold on
gone! Goes for the reverse sweep from outside off, and he ends up gloving it, and it goes off the keeper's shoulder and the man at slip takes a superb overhead catch, diving backwards
bowled him! He's come down the track and it was the arm ball. He looked to defend and it sneaked through the gap between bat and pad and clattered into the stumps
and that's another. Made a lot of room to cut. Was too full for that and it went with the arm and smacked into the middle of leg and middle

taken! Shakib has struck first ball of his new spell. It was tossed up on middle stump and he looked to drive inside-out through cover. It turned and he ended up slicing his drive, uppishly, and Sunny dives to his right at point and takes an excellent low catch

dismissalText.long: c Mashrafe Mortaza b Al-Amin Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Regis Chakabva c Mashrafe Mortaza b Al-Amin Hossain 32 (53b 2x4 0x6 58m) SR: 60.37

dismissalComment.html: got him! It was the slower ball outside off, not quite driving length, and it stopped on Chakabva as he pushed forward to drive. Tried to check his shot but ended up scooping it in the air to mid-off. Mashrafe stumbles backwards as he takes the catch but does well to hold on

dismissalText.long: c Arafat Sunny b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Solomon Mire c Arafat Sunny b Shakib Al Hasan 50 (79b 2x4 0x6 113m) SR: 63.29

dismissalComment.html: taken! Shakib has struck first ball of his new spell. It was tossed up on middle stump and he looked to drive inside-out through cover. It turned and he ended up slicing his drive, uppishly, and Sunny dives to his right at point and takes an excellent low catch

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura run out (Sabbir Rahman) 38 (31b 5x4 0x6 64m) SR: 122.58

dismissalComment.html: that is brilliant fielding! He comes down the track and plays a checked drive towards mid-off and sets off for the single. Sabbir is the fielder and he quickly susses out that the keeper's end is the one to shy to, since Chigumbura was a little late to respond to Panyangara's call. He threw down the stumps direct, and Chiggy was out by a mile.

dismissalText.commentary: Tinashe Panyangara b Arafat Sunny 8 (31b 1x4 0x6 40m) SR: 25.8

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! He's come down the track and it was the arm ball. He looked to defend and it sneaked through the gap between bat and pad and clattered into the stumps

milestones.description: Shakib has scored 32 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Tamim Iqbal's record

stories.title: Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 2014-15
stories.subTitle: 2nd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 2014-15
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the second ODI, Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 2014-15

stories.title: Mashrafe Mortaza chases perfection
stories.subTitle: Zimbabwe in Bangladesh 2014
stories.summary: Mashrafe Mortaza felt he was only "80 percent satisfied" with his work though he took three wickets and set up Bangladesh's victory in the second ODI against Zimbabwe

image.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza is congratulated by team-mates after a wicket
image.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza is congratulated by team-mates after a wicket , Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Chittagong, November 23, 2014

stories.title: 'Chigumbura run-out the turning point' - Captains
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Chittagong
stories.summary: The dismissal of Elton Chigumbura in the 42nd over was the turning point in the second ODI in Chittagong, both the captains agreed

image.caption: Rubel Hossain is ecstatic after Sabbir Rahman's throw catches Elton Chigumbura short
image.longCaption: Rubel Hossain is ecstatic after Sabbir Rahman's throw catches Elton Chigumbura short, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Chittagong, November 23, 2014

stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Chittagong

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan is distraught after losing his stumps to a slower ball

stories.title: Openers, Mortaza set up 68-run win
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Chittagong
stories.summary: Bangladesh overpowered Zimbabwe in the second ODI that saw the fortunes of both teams seesawing and consolidated their lead in the five-match series
stories.byline: The Report by Mohammad Isam in Chittagong

image.caption: Anamul Haque plays through the offside
image.longCaption: Anamul Haque plays through the offside, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Chittagong, November 23, 2014

stories.title: Can't rely on one player - Mashrafe Mortaza
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Chittagong
stories.seoTitle: Can't rely on one player - Mashrafe Mortaza
stories.summary: Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza has said his team cannot afford to rely on only one individual and everyone should contribute towards the winning cause of the team

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan attacks during his 101
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan attacks during his 101, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Chittagong, November 21, 2014

stories.title: Bereft Zimbabwe search for form
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Chittagong
stories.summary: Zimbabwe have a lot to work on, but their goal is simpler. They would want to equalise instead of conceding a 2-0 lead before moving to Dhaka for the last three games
stories.byline: The Preview by Mohammad Isam in Chittagong
